newsitem.title: GERMANY: ATHLETICS-URRUTIA SMASHES INDOOR TRIPLE JUMP RECORD.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-URRUTIA SMASHES INDOOR TRIPLE JUMP RECORD.

text.p: Cuban Alliacer Urrutia smashed the world indoor record for the men's triple jump when he jumped 17.83 metres at the Sindelfingen athletics meeting on Saturday.

Urrutia, used to playing second fiddle to his better-known compatriot Yoelvis Quesada, added six centimetres to the previous best of 17.77 set by Russian Leonid Voloshin in Grenoble, France in February 1994.
The early part of the meeting also saw an impressive 60 metres victory from Britain's Linford Christie.

Christie, the 1992 Olympic champion whose 100 metres campaign at the 1996 Atlanta Games ended in a disqualification for two false starts in the final, came through strongly in the last 20 metres to win comfortably in a fast 6.51 seconds.
